alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 24 at 4:21PM MST until July 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 500 PM MST. * At 421 PM MST, thunderstorm outflow winds capable of generating blowing dust was along a line extending from near Freeman to 14 miles south of Maricopa to 12 miles west of Chui-Chu, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 124 and 176. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 8 and 44. AZ Route 347 between mile markers 161 and 177. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Maricopa, Estrella, Freeman, Big Horn, Estrella Sailport, Arizola, Sonoran National Monument, Stanfield, Ak- Chin Village, and Mobile. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
